page.title: 14The Sports Centre
page.content: The South Wansdyke Sports Centre in Midsomer Norton was built in a year and opened in September 1980. Last year (1984) an extension was built which provided space for more activities and clubs. There is a swimming pool and squash courts. In the new building there are two rooms: The Ambares Hall and a weight training room. Some of the activities that take place here are trampolining, gymnastics, judo and keep fit. The most popular activity in the centre is swimming, there are life saving, survival and swimming classes. The main pool is 25m by 8.6m. There is alearners pool built as a bay off the end of the main pool. Interesting features of the pool are its level deck construction and an ozone water treatment system. The centre is used by 3,800 each week.
